channel.title: Bloomberg Markets
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: SEC’s Atkins Eyes Limits on Data Collected From Hedge Funds
item.description: US Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Paul Atkins said Wednesday that he wants agency staff to consider narrowing the scope of data that private fund advisers would have to provide the regulator under upcoming rules.
item.dc:creator: Lydia Beyoud

media:content.media:description: Securities and Exchange Commission Paul Atkins

item.title: Oil Extends Jump as US Pulls Some Embassy Staff From Middle East
item.description: Oil extended its biggest daily gain since October after the US ordered some staff to depart its embassy in Baghdad and allowed military service members’ families to leave the Middle East amid rising security risks.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: The US Embassy in Baghdad, Iraq.

item.title: US Energy Secretary Says Oil Output Drop in 2026 Is ‘Unlikely’
item.description: US Energy Secretary Chris Wright said it’s “unlikely” that the country’s oil production will drop next year, contrary to the expectations released this week by a government agency.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Crowley

media:content.media:description: Chris Wright, US secretary of energy, arrives for a House Appropriations Subcommittee on Energy and Water Development and Related Agencies hearing in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. The hearing is reviewing the fiscal year 2026 budget requests for the US Department of Energy.

item.title: Top Meat Processor JBS Delays Start of New York Trading
item.description: JBS NV, the world’s largest meat producer, has delayed the start of trading of its shares in New York by one day, according to a regulatory filing.
item.dc:creator: Gerson Freitas Jr

media:content.media:description: The JBS Greeley meatpacking facility in Greeley, Colorado, US, on Friday, Feb. 28, 2025. Plans for the biggest deportations in US history threaten to upend the meatpacking industry.

item.title: Warner Bros. Says to Settle Buyback, Consent Solicitation Early
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. intends to exercise its right to settle its bond buyback and consent solicitation early, on June 30, for investors that have agreed to sell some of their bonds to the company and change covenants on the other securities, according to a company filing.
item.dc:creator: Dan Wilchins

media:content.media:description: Warner Bros. Studios in Burbank, California, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 2, 2023. Warner Bros Discovery Inc. released earnings figures on Aug. 3.

item.title: Ivanhoe Restarts Part of Congo Copper Mine Impacted by Flooding
item.description: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. has restarted underground operations in part of its giant copper mine in the Democratic Republic of Congo while another section remains offline after seismic activity caused flooding deep below ground.
item.dc:creator: James Attwood

media:content.media:description: This April 26, 2018 general view shows the mining site of Kamoa Kakula, exploited by Kamoa Holding (Ivanhoe Mines, Zijin Mining Group, together with the DRC government), in Kamoa, 25km from Kolwezi. - The mining site is one of the largest unexploited copper field in the world, and stands on the site of the battles for Kolwezi, in May 1978 during the second Shaba War where French and Belgian paratroopers fought agains the Katanga rebels. On May 19, 1978, French soldiers parachuted into the Democratic Republic of Congo town of Kolwezi to rescue hundreds of Europeans held by rebels who had already massacred several. (Photo by CAROLINE THIRION / AFP) (Photo credit should read CAROLINE THIRION/AFP via Getty Images)

item.title: Trans Mountain Eyes Pipeline Capacity Increase by Early 2027
item.description: The Trans Mountain pipeline could handle an additional 75,000 barrels of crude a day by a early 2027, the government-owned company’s top executive said, potentially helping Canadian oil producers expand shipments to non-US markets.
item.dc:creator: Robert Tuttle

media:content.media:description: Storage tanks at the Burnaby Terminal at the end point of the Trans Mountain Pipeline System in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada, on Thursday, May 2, 2024. The expanded Trans Mountain pipeline has entered commercial operation, concluding a decade-long wait for one of Canadas largest and most controversial energy projects.

item.title: Bessent Says Dollar-Linked Stablecoins Could Hit $2T
item.description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says that dollar-linked stablecoins could hit $2 trillion or even more while answering questions at a Senate Appropriations subcommittee hearing.

item.title: How Magic Johnson Built a Business Empire
item.description: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit with Magic Johnson to discuss how he was able to make the transition from being a legendary basketball player to a successful businessman. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Chanos Hits Back Strategy’s Saylor, Calling Him a ‘Salesman’
item.description: Famed short-seller Jim Chanos denounced Strategy’s Michael Saylor for using a misleading model to value his crypto-treasury firm and reemphasized his recommendation to short its shares and buy Bitcoin instead.
item.dc:creator: Yiqin Shen, Scarlet Fu

media:content.media:description: Jim Chanos, founder and president of Chanos & Company LP, during a Bloomberg Television interview in New York, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. Chanos discussed the state of markets and his concerns about the lack of oversight in the crypto market.

item.title: Bank of China, JPMorgan Among Banks in Argentina $2 Billion Repo
item.description: Argentina launched an agreement with seven private banks on a repurchase agreement of $2 billion, money aimed at bolstering the central bank’s foreign reserves.
item.dc:creator: Kevin Simauchi

media:content.media:description: The Central Bank of Argentina in the financial district of Buenos Aires, Argentina, on Thursday, April 27, 2023. Argentina's parallel exchange rate, known as the blue-chip swap, is in free-fall as locals rush to buy the US dollar amid rampant inflation, falling reserves and speculation over a devaluation of the official peso.

item.title: Trump Says China Will Ship Rare Earths in ‘Done’ Trade Deal
item.description: President Donald Trump said a trade framework with China has been completed, with Beijing supplying rare earths and magnets “UP FRONT” and the US allowing Chinese students into its colleges and universities. The US and China will maintain tariffs at their current, lower levels following the two nations’ agreement this week in London, Trump said Wednesday. That number is still higher than before the president took office. Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping and he must still formally sign off on the agreement. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: AI Apps Could Grow 100x Over Next Few Years: B Capital
item.description: Raj Ganguly, Co-CEO & Co-Founder at B Capital Group Management speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu about the future of AI in the venture capital space. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fitch Sees Worsening Outlook for North American Companies
item.description: Fitch Ratings revised its 2025 outlook on North American non-financial firms to “deteriorating” from “neutral,” expecting high tariffs to stoke inflation and dampen consumers’ ability to spend.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Hall

media:content.media:description: Shoppers in downtown San Francisco, California, US, on Tuesday, March 11, 2025. The Bureau of Labor Statistics is scheduled to release US consumer price index (CPI) figures on March 12. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Nuclear Startup Oklo to Raise $400 Million in Share Offering
item.description: Oklo Inc., a nuclear energy startup developing small reactors, is seeking to raise as much as $400 million in a secondary share offering.
item.dc:creator: Will Wade

item.title: David Bahnsen Names Top Stocks in his Portfolio
item.description: David Bahnsen, Chief Investment Officer, The Bahnsen Group speaks with Romaine Bostick and Alix Steel about the top stocks in his portfolio. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Biotech Innovation is Privatizing: Science Venture CEO
item.description: John Flavin, Portal Innovations, Founder & CEO speaks with Romaine Bostick and Alix Steel about the outlook on investing in biotech. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: DoubleLine’s Gundlach Says ‘Reckoning Is Coming’ for US Debt
item.description: America’s debt burden and interest expense have become “untenable,” a situation that may lead investors to move out of dollar-based assets, according to DoubleLine Capital’s Jeffrey Gundlach.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Weinman, Lisa Abramowicz

item.title: Treasuries Add to Post-CPI Gains After Strong Auction Demand
item.description: Treasuries surged after strong demand for an auction of 10-year notes and benign US inflation data that bolstered the outlook for more than one Federal Reserve interest-rate cut this year.
item.dc:creator: Michael Mackenzie, Ye Xie

item.title: Major Averages Slip After CPI Print | Closing Bell
item.description: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Norah Mulinda, & David Gura. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Trump’s Repeal of Pollution Rules Paves Way for New Dirty Plants
item.description: The Trump administration’s plan to repeal power-plant pollution mandates will make it easier and cheaper for utilities to build new fossil fuel-fired plants, while stalling investment in clean energy.
item.dc:creator: Mark Chediak

media:content.media:description: The Gateway Generating Station natural gas-fired power plant in Antioch, California, US, on Thursday, Feb. 9, 2023. California Governor Gavin Newsom called for federal energy regulators to investigate a recent hike in natural gas prices that has resulted in sky-high utility bills.

item.title: Dollar Could Drop 10% in a Year, Says Tudor Jones
item.description: Paul Tudor Jones sees the US dollar dropping over the next year as short-term interest rates fall sharply, he said. He speaks on Bloomberg Open Interest. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Kirkland & Ellis Debt Architect Sees Creditor Pacts as ‘Anticompetitive’
item.description: Kirkland & Ellis debt finance partner David Nemecek, who represents companies and their owners in many of the market’s biggest debt overhauls, warned that a popular tool allowing creditors to band together for greater negotiating leverage against borrowers could be illegal.
item.dc:creator: Eliza Ronalds-Hannon, Reshmi Basu

media:content.media:description: David Nemecek, partner of Kirkland & Ellis LLP, during the Bloomberg Global Credit Forum in Los Angeles, California, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. The world's credit markets are having a moment, but trade wars, persistent inflation and growing concern of a slowdown in the world's largest economy loom large.

item.title: S&P 500 Snaps Three-Day Win Streak as Traders Eye US-China Trade
item.description: US stocks snapped a three-day winning streak on Wednesday, retreating from near all-time highs as traders looked past an upbeat report on cooling consumer prices and weighed the outlook for global trade.
item.dc:creator: Jess Menton

media:content.media:description: Traders work on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in New York, US, on Thursday, April 10, 2025. Risk appetites vanished on Wall Street after the biggest burst of buying in years, with stocks falling even after subdued inflation data extended a bounce in Treasuries.

item.title: Vanguard Seeks SEC Approval to Expand Tax-Busting Fund Design
item.description: Vanguard Group Inc., the investment giant famous for low-cost index funds, is seeking regulatory approval to expand its signature tax-saving fund structure — as anticipation grows that the Securities and Exchange Commission under Paul Atkins will soon embrace the design en masse.
item.dc:creator: Emily Graffeo

item.title: S&P 500 Halts Rally Near Record as Big Tech Swoons: Markets Wrap
item.description: A slide in big tech dragged down stocks, following a rally that drove the S&P 500 to a striking distance of its all-time highs. Earlier gains were fueled by surprisingly benign inflation data that stoked bets on Federal Reserve rate cuts, spurring a drop in bond yields.
item.dc:creator: Rita Nazareth, Andre Janse Van Vuuren

item.title: Space Firm Voyager Technologies Jumps 82% After Upsized IPO
item.description: Voyager Technologies Inc. shares ended their debut trading day up 82% after the company raised $383 million in an upsized US initial public offering.
item.dc:creator: Norah Mulinda, Anthony Hughes

media:content.media:description: Voyager Technologies signage outside the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) during the company's initial public offering (IPO) in New York, US, on Wednesday, June 11, 2025. Voyager Technologies Inc. is seeking to raise as much as $319 million in an initial public offering, as it looks to capitalize on rising government spending on advanced defense technologies and space exploration.

item.title: Morgan Stanley Seeks xAI Debt Buyers After Trump Feud
item.description: Morgan Stanley is reaching out to a broader pool of investors to shore up demand for a $5 billion debt sale for Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence startup xAI Corp., a deal that offers a window into the fallout from the billionaire’s feud with US President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: Carmen Arroyo, Jill R Shah, Gowri Gurumurthy

media:content.media:description: The xAI logo on a smartphone arranged in New York, US, on Thursday, Dec. 7, 2023. Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company xAI is seeking to raise $1 billion in funding from equity investors, according to a new filing.

item.title: GM Dodges Tariffs With Production Shift to The US
item.description: General Motors plans to invest $4 billion in its US plants over the next two years in response to President Donald Trump's tariffs, which will expand factories in Michigan, Kansas, and Tennessee. GM's CFO Brian Jacobson spoke to Matt Miller about the production shift. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Fitch Says Global Energy Outlook Worsens on Tariff, OPEC+ Woes
item.description: Fitch Ratings has revised its 2025 outlook on the global oil and gas sector to ‘deteriorating’ from ‘neutral’ as a combination of US tariffs, OPEC+ output hikes and growing non-OPEC+ supply weigh on demand.
item.dc:creator: Georgia Hall

media:content.media:description: Flares burn off excess natural gas at the Endeavor Energy Resources LP oil and gas wells near Tarzan, Texas, US, on Saturday, March 15, 2025. The Permian Basin, a sprawling shale patch that lies beneath Texas and New Mexico, is North America's most prolific shale patch.
